description._content: Image taken from: Title: "The Case of Mary Queen of Scots, and of Elizabeth Queen of England, legally, briefly, and historically stated: embracing the amorous life of the Virgin Queen, and identifying her with all the plans that led to Mary's ruin and murder. With an account of last moments of Mary, her letter to Elizabeth, and Davison's apology about the death warrant, etc" Author: CAMPBELL, Hugh - LL.D Contributor: DAVISON, William - Secretary of State to Queen Elizabeth Contributor: Mary - Queen of Scots Shelfmark: "British Library HMNTS 600.f.20." Page: 10 Place of Publishing: London Date of Publishing: 1825 Publisher: Sherwood, Jones & Co. Issuance: monographic Identifier: 000585250 Note: The colours, contrast and appearance of these illustrations are unlikely to be true to life. They are derived from scanned images that have been enhanced for machine interpretation and have been altered from their originals. If you wish to purchase a high quality copy of the page that this image is drawn from, please order it here.
